abstract.text: A specific characteristic of a service, like the brightness of a dimmable light or its color temperature.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: instance represents an aspect of a service that provides data, or that your app can control.
You don’t create characteristic instances. Instead, an accessory manufacturer incorporates them into a device, which publishes them to you through the
array that indicates attributes like readability, writability, and user-visibility. They also have a
property that tells your app what the characteristic controls or describes. Device manufacturers can use one of the standard types, given in
, or they can create custom types.

that you can read or write. Some characteristics use plain numbers, Booleans, or strings. Others have application specific meanings declared in enumerations associated with the given characteristic type. The characteristic’s
can help your app interpret the value.

abstract.text: Configure, control, and communicate with home automation accessories.
A home automation accessory, like a garage door opener or a thermostat.
An object that setups up new accessories.
An object that describes how to add and setup up new accessories.
A result object describing information about a successful accessory setup request.
A specific characteristic of a service, like the brightness of a dimmable light or its color temperature.
The type of the characteristic.
Enables or disables notifications for changes in the value of the characteristic.
A Boolean indicating whether the characteristic has been set to send notifications.
The localized description of the characteristic.
Metadata about the units and other properties of the characteristic.
An array of properties that describe the characteristic.
Reads the value for the characteristic.
The service that contains this characteristic.
A unique identifier for the characteristic.
Sets or clears authorization data used when writing to the characteristic.
The current value of the characteristic.
Modifies the value of the characteristic.
Metadata that describes a characteristic’s value and that may be useful for presentation purposes.
An interface from which to read and, if allowed by the accessory, update the ordering of input sources.
A controllable feature of an accessory, like a light attached to a garage door opener.
An array of characteristics for the service.
The properties that characteristics can have.
The characteristic types supported by HomeKit-based accessories.
Find all the automation accessories in the primary home and control their state.

doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/Ho.title: Interacting with a home automation network

abstract.text: The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
